extendedIngredients.name: beet
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 teaspoons beet powder (I use this beet powder from Hoosier Hill Farms.)
metaInformation: (I use this beet powder from Hoosier Hill Farms.)

extendedIngredients.name: chocolate chips
extendedIngredients.originalString: 10 chocolate chips, optional garnish (Use raw chocolate or an allergen-free, gluten-free product like Enjoy Life.)
metaInformation: (Use chocolate or an allergen-free, product like Enjoy Life.)

extendedIngredients.name: coconut flakes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 teaspoon all-natural organic unsweetened coconut flakes, optional garnish

extendedIngredients.name: maple syrup
extendedIngredients.originalString: Up to 1 teaspoon pure maple syrup or honey, or other sweetener (I omit sweetener as I find the oatmeal sweet enough for my tastes, but adjust according to your own tastes.)
metaInformation: for my tastes, but adjust according to your own tastes.)

extendedIngredients.name: oats
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ cup certified gluten-free quick oats (I use these from Bob's Red Mill.)

extendedIngredients.name: salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: Pinch of salt, optional but I like a bit of Maldon

extendedIngredients.name: unsweetened coconut milk
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup unsweetened coconut milk (or other milk)

extendedIngredients.name: vanilla extract
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ to ½ teaspoon pure vanilla extract (my choice is Nielsen Massey)

recipes.title: All-Natural Gluten-Free Red Velvet Oatmeal
recipes.instructions: Combine oats, beet powder, cocoa and salt in a bowl; stir to blend.Add milk and oil.Microwave 1-2 minutes, until bubbling and oats are cooked.Remove from microwave, stir and add in vanilla extract and sweetener (if using). Stir to combine.Top with a few chocolate chips and coconut flakes, if desired.Serve immediately.May be made on stovetop, if you prefer, simply cook until boiling over medium flame, instead of microwaving.

steps.step: Combine oats, beet powder, cocoa and salt in a bowl; stir to blend.
Add milk and oil.Microwave 1-2 minutes, until bubbling and oats are cooked.
Remove from microwave, stir and add in vanilla extract and sweetener (if using). Stir to combine.Top with a few chocolate chips and coconut flakes, if desired.
Serve immediately.May be made on stovetop, if you prefer, simply cook until boiling over medium flame, instead of microwaving.
